section.title: Rationale
section.lq:
ejosejulie wrote: > In the troubleshooting section of the document, I want to design the > page with all the questions in the beginning that is linked to the > answers in the same page. Please explain how to do it? The low-tech way is to use for the questions at the beginning. Each one points to the Question+Answer which comes later in the topic. I'd probably use
for a Question+Answer, for the question, and <p> for the answer. <concept id="thistopic"> <title>Troubleshooting What is foo?
What is foo?

foo is a word used as a placeholder by geeks.

section.lq: Or a reference topic, with nested reference topic children - put the <related-links> to the children in the container reference topic. Same idea as others, but moving from xref and section to link and topic, which I tend to prefer for architectural reasons (like ability to integrate with map-based linking at some later point)
